Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: CORE ID: Unique identifier for a well core
Column Comment.3: ANALYSIS OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number for each unique analysisobservation.
Column Comment.4: SAMPLE NUMBER: Number or code assigned by the analysis laboratory to the coreplug sample.
Column Comment.5: SAMPLE ANALYSIS OBSERVATION NUMBER: identifying number is assignedusing the Obs No architectural principle.
Column Comment.6: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.7: ANALYSIS SOURCE: The source that the analysis came from, this could be a labtechnician, a lab, a company, a government agency, etc.
Column Comment.8: BULK DENSITY: Measured bulk density of the core sample. Bulk density is thecombined density of rock and fluids in the pore spaces.
Column Comment.9: BULK DENSITY OUOM: Bulk density original unit of measure.
Column Comment.10: BULK MASS OIL SATURATION: Bulk mass of the oil.
Column Comment.11: BULK MASS OIL SATURATION OUOM: Bulk mass oil original unit of measure.
Column Comment.12: BULK MASS SAND SATURATION: Bulk mass of the sand.
Column Comment.13: BULK MASS SAND SATURATION OUOM: Bulk mass sand original unit of measure.
Column Comment.14: BULK MASS WATER SATURATION: Bulk mass of the water.
Column Comment.15: BULK MASS WATER SATURATION OUOM: Bulk mass water original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.16: BULK VOLUME OIL SATURATION: Percentage of crude oil in a unit volume.
Column Comment.17: BULK VOLUME WATER SATURATION: Percentage of water in a unit volume.
Column Comment.18: CONFINING PERMEABILITY PRESSURE: The permeability pressure. The confiningpressure at which the permeability of the core sample was taken.
Column Comment.19: CONFINING PERMEABILITY PRESSURE OUOM: Permeability (analysis) pressureoriginal unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: CONFINING POROSITY PRESSURE: The measurement of confining porositypressure.
Column Comment.21: CONFINING POROSITY PRESSURE OUOM: Porosity pressure original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.22: CONFINING FLUID SATURATION PRESSURE: Measurement of fluid saturationpressure. The pressure is used to saturate the plug sample.
Column Comment.23: CONFINING FLUID SATURATION PRESSURE OUOM: Fluid saturation pressureoriginal unit of measure.
Column Comment.24: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.25: EFFECTIVE POROSITY: Porosity including only the interconnected pores.
Column Comment.26: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.27: GAS SATURATION VOLUME: Percent of gas saturation (the percent volume of thecore pore space occupied by gas).
Column Comment.28: GRAIN DENSITY: Measured grain density of the core sample. Grain density is theunit volume of minerals with zero porosity.
Column Comment.29: GRAIN DENSITY OUOM: Grain density original unit of measure.
Column Comment.30: GRAIN MASS OIL SATURATION: The grain mass of oil.
Column Comment.31: GRAIN MASS OIL SATURATION OUOM: Grain mass oil original unit of measure.
Column Comment.32: GRAIN MASS WATER SATURATION: The grain mass of water.
Column Comment.33: GRAIN MASS WATER SATURATION OUOM: Grain mass water original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.34: INTERVAL DEPTH: Measured depth to the base of the core analysis interval.
Column Comment.35: INTERVAL DEPTH OUOM: Interval depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.36: INTERVAL LENGTH: Measured length of the cored interval undergoing analysis.
Column Comment.37: INTERVAL LENGTH OUOM: Interval length original unit of measure.
Column Comment.38: K90: Horizontal 90 degree permeability records the horizontal permeability measured90 angular degrees from the maximum horizontal permeability.
Column Comment.39: K90 OUOM: Permeability at 90 degrees original unit of measure.
Column Comment.40: K90 QUALITY: A reference table describing standard quality indicators. For examplepoor, good, very good or excellent.
Column Comment.41: KMAX: Maximum horizontal permeability measurement. This measurement isgenerally made parallel to the direction of principle fracture.
Column Comment.42: KMAX OUOM: Maximum permeability original unit of measure.
Column Comment.43: KMAX QUALITY: A reference table describing standard quality indicators. Forexample poor, good, very good or excellent.
Column Comment.44: KVERT: Vertical permeability records the permeability measured with respect to thevertical orientation of the core.
Column Comment.45: KVERT OUOM: Vertical permeability original unit of measure.
Column Comment.46: K VERT QUALITY: A reference table describing standard quality indicators. Forexample poor, good, very good or excellent.
Column Comment.47: OIL SATURATION: Percent of oil saturation by weight. This method is only used fortar sands, or oil shales etc.
Column Comment.48: PORE VOLUME GAS SATURATION: Volume percentage of gas saturation in thepore spaces of the core sample (residual water saturation). Commonly reported forNorth Sea data.
Column Comment.49: PORE VOLUME OIL SATURATION: Volume percentage of oil saturation in the porespaces of the core sample (residual oil saturation).
Column Comment.50: PORE VOLUME WATER SATURATION: Volume percentage of water saturation inthe pore spaces of the core sample (residual water saturation).
Column Comment.51: POROSITY: Percent volume or pore space in the reservoir rock with a capacity forstoring fluids.
Column Comment.52: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.53: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.54: TOP DEPTH: Depth to the top of the core analysis interval or the measured depth ofa specific core sample undergoing analysis.
Column Comment.55: TOP DEPTH OUOM: Top measured depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.56: WATER SATURATION: Percent water saturation by weight. This method is onlyused for tar sands, or oil shales, etc.
Column Comment.57: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.58: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.59: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.60: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.61: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.62: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.63: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
